definition: surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]

sentences.english: Virus-infected emails struck fear into the Microsoft Company.
sentences.chinese: 攜帶病毒的電子郵件引起了微軟公司的恐慌。

sentences.english: But that's what Microsoft said about Windows and IE.
sentences.chinese: 但微軟也正是這樣說視窗和IE的啊。

sentences.english: The instantmessaging feature appears to be one part of Microsoft's response.
sentences.chinese: 即時通服務似乎是微軟對此舉動作出迴應的一部分。

sentences.english: Buy the pass on a message of sina to Microsoft general, the expert inside course of study expresses generally open-eyed .
sentences.chinese: 對微軟將收購新浪的傳言，業內專家普遍表示驚訝。

sentences.english: Will Microsoft open testing sign-ups again when RC1 is released?
sentences.chinese: 微軟是否會再RC1發佈時打開測試註冊嗎？

sentences.english: The advantage of Microsoft's method is that it works better for on-screen reading.
sentences.chinese: 微軟的做法的好處在於它更利於屏幕閱讀。

sentences.english: Battelle asks if Yahoo is talking to Microsoft about any kind of deal.
sentences.chinese: 伯特立問雅虎是否在跟微軟商討某項交易。

sentences.english: What can the plan be with Microsoft's purchase of hot startup Powerset?
sentences.chinese: 微軟購買火熱的創業公司powerset有何計劃？

sentences.english: All in all, Microsoft made some great improvements with the Active Directory Administrative Center.
sentences.chinese: 總而言之，微軟在活動目錄管理中心中做了很多改進。

sentences.english: Spokeswomen for Apple and Microsoft declined to comment.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果公司和微軟公司的發言人拒絕置評。

sentences.english: Microsoft announced a Windows Cloud OS.
sentences.chinese: 微軟公佈了其雲計算操作系統。

sentences.english: Microsoft has reason to be glib.
But " eye covetously " Microsoft is apparent not reconciled to.
sentences.chinese: 但“虎視眈眈”的微軟顯然不甘心。

sentences.english: Microsoft did not offer an official comment.
sentences.chinese: 微軟沒有發佈官方消息。

sentences.english: Microsoft, the emphasis is on innovation capability.
sentences.chinese: 微軟講究的是開拓創新能力。

sentences.english: But a lot of people use Windows phones, prior or current.
sentences.chinese: 但是無論以前還是現在很多人都在使用微軟手機。

definition: tycoon/magnate/big player (including company, country, school etc)/big shot
